Welcome to Calico¶

Project Calico is an open source solution for virtual networking in cloud data centers, developed by Metaswitch Networks and released under the Apache 2.0 License. You can find more information about it on our website.

Architecture¶

Calico represents a new approach to virtual networking, based on the same scalable IP networking principles as the Internet. See Calico Architecture Overview for an overview of how Calico works and what a Calico deployment contains.

Getting Started¶

  • Installation Instructions
  • Calico Verification

Getting Source Code¶

All of the source code is on GitHub, in the following repositories, separated by function

Product Code¶

  • calico - the Felix agent, the ACL manager, and the officially-supported orchestrator plugins.
  • calico-neutron - Calico-specific patched version of OpenStack Neutron.
  • calico-nova - Calico-specific patched version of OpenStack Nova.
  • calico-dnsmasq - Calico-specific patched version of dnsmasq.

Infrastructure¶

  • calico-chef - Chef cookbooks for installing test versions of OpenStack-using-Calico.

Contributing¶

You can contribute by making a GitHub pull request. See Contribution Guidelines for details.

Support¶

If you want help or to help others, check out Support.

License and Acknowledgements¶

Calico’s license is documented in LICENSE.txt.

It also makes use of other open source components as acknowledged in README.txt.
